New Records: Arshdeep Singh achieved a career-best four for nine
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli c Gous b Netravalkar 0 (India 1-1)
WICKET! Jasdeep run-out (Pant/Siraj) 2 USA 110-8 after 20 overs
WICKET! Harmeet c Pant b Arshdeep 10 (USA 98-7)
WICKET! Anderson c Pant b Hardik 15 (USA 96-6)
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and chose to field first
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Jones: “I would say we were 10-15 runs short, if we got 125, 130 it would be a tough total.”
Rohit Sharma: “We knew it was going to be a tough task, we lost some wickets early.”
Arshdeep Singh: “I’m very pleased with the performance.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch dictated that New Yorkers wouldn’t be watching big-hitting six-fests
USA were given a five-run penalty for breaching the sixty second gap between overs for the third time
India qualified for the Super Eight stage of the T20 World Cup with a seven-wicket win over the United States
Others: The USA will also ensure qualification for the next round if they beat Ireland on Friday
England take on Oman in a must-win game tomorrow
